com.github.kaktushose.jda.commands.entities

Class JDACommands

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.kaktushose.jda.commands.JDACommands

  • public class JDACommands
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to represent an active instance of this framework and provides access to the CommandSettings and the CommandList.

    It is basically an abstraction of CommandDispatcher in order to filter the access to methods and attributes. An instance of this class may only be created through the JDACommandsBuilder due to the high complexity of CommandDispatcher.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    1.1.1
    Author:
    Kaktushose
    See Also:
    JDACommandsBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultSettings

        public CommandSettings getDefaultSettings()
        Get the default CommandSettings.
        Returns:
        the CommandSettings of this instance

      • getGuildSettings

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,CommandSettings> getGuildSettings()
        Get the CommandSettingss that are mapped to a guild. This Map is mutable and thus can be modified in order to add or remove guild settings. Returns an empty Map if no guild settings have been defined yet.
        Returns:
        a mutable Map containing all the guild specific CommandSettingss

      • getCommands

        public CommandList getCommands()
        Get the CommandList of the current framework instance.
        Returns:
        the CommandList of this instance

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down the current framework instance. This will unregister the message listener and clear the CommandList. Thus it is possible to build a new JDACommands instance after this method got invoked.
